page.title: 08About Speldhurst
page.content: Northfield Public House in Speldhurst was built in 1861. The oldest houses in Speldhurst are in Bullingston Lane. The oven in the Bakers is over a hundred years old, it is now worked by oil. There is an original Hovis clock on the wall in the shop. They have got a roll maker in the kitchen which is quite old. They use nice old pills to get the bread out of the oven. The grocers shop is quite new, it was originally a butchers shop. The George and Dragon Pub was built in 13th century. The church,{Saint Mary the {Virgin,}is as old. The Choir vestry was built in 1897 as a memorial of the Diamond Jubilee of Queen Victoria. The Priests vestry was added in 1923. Speldhurst School is 126 years old and some of it's bricks are made of sandstone.
